name: Organisation for Respect and Care of Animals
goal:
ORCA’s aims are (as described in the Statute):

1) Contribution to animal welfare and environmental protection as an integral part of policies in agriculture, fishing, hunting, veterinary medicine, transportation, commerce, industry, tourism, forestry, research, science, environmental protection and other areas that may affect animal welfare and its improvement on local, national, regional and international level;
2) Contribution to the protection and conservation of biological diversity and other components of the environment, by promoting the principles of sustainable development;
3) Contribution to the realization of human rights and improving social well being through the improvement of animal welfare and environmental protection;
4) Contribution to rural development, improvement of sustainable agriculture, sustainable forestry and sustainable tourism, through the improvement of animal welfare and environmental protection;
5) Contribution to the improvement of public health through improving animal welfare and environmental protection;
6) Contribution to the improvement of food safety and security, as well as consumer rights through improving animal welfare and environmental protection;
7) Contribution to the improvement of public safety and public order through improving animal welfare and environmental protection;
8) Contribution to the advancement of scientific research through improving animal welfare;
9) Contribution to the improvement and implementation of public policies and regulations regarding animal welfare and environmental protection;
10) Contribution to the improvement of animal welfare education and environmental education as part of formal education;
11) Raising public awareness about the importance of animal welfare and environmental protection and their connection to economic development and social well being;
12) Contribution to preventing and sanctioning all forms of animal mistreatment and abuse, and helping animals whose good state of welfare is compromised;
13) Contribution to preventing and reducing all forms of discrimination and violence in society;
14) Promotion of individual responsibility, civic activism and voluntarism aimed at solving local community problems, better understanding amongst people, friendship and peace;
15) Development of principles of corporate social responsibility;
16) Promotion of creativity and activism of children and youth;
17) Promotion of healthy lifestyles as a way of improving animal welfare, preservation of human health and environmental protection;
18) Contribution to the preservation and development of veterinary science, animal husbandry, biology and other professions that are directly or indirectly connected to animal welfare and environmental protection, i.e. promoting animal welfare and environmental protection as an integral part of these professions;
19) Contribution to professional development of employees in primary, secondary, and higher education, media, police, judiciary, inspection and customs control, in other segments of the state administration and in the civil sector, and promoting the active contribution of these professions to animal welfare and the environmental protection.
interests: Agriculture and Rural Development, Climate Action, Consumers, Education and training, Environment, Food Safety, International co-operation and development, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Public Health, Regional Policy, Youth
euInitiatives: ORCA implements activities directed toward supporting Serbia's EU integration process (focusing on negotiation chapters related to agriculture and rural development – Chapter 11; food safety, veterinary and fitosanitary policy - Chapter 12; fisheries – Chapter 13 and environment and climate change – Chapter 27). ORCA is a member of the EU Platform on Animal Welfare, an expert group tasked to assist the European Commission with the development and exchange of coordinated actions on animal welfare. ORCA has been selected by DG SANTE as only CSO from the Western Balkan region. ORCA is committed to the improvement of policies, legislation and practice related to animal welfare, environmental protection in Serbia, through various activities such as analysis, creating proposals to change the laws and regulations, creation of policy documents, and advocating for the adoption of such proposals (e.g. Animal Welfare Law, Nature Protection Law, Veterinary Law, National Sustainable Development Strategy, etc.). Currently, in the frame of the EU funded regional project, we are coordinating development of a regional policy on sustainable agriculture.
